headline: Where We Stand on the Pandemic
snippet: As summer draws to a close, four new developments in the treatment and understanding of the coronavirus have arisen in the United States and abroad.
abstract: As summer draws to a close, four new developments in the treatment and understanding of the coronavirus have arisen in the United States and abroad.

headline: C.D.C. Changes Testing Guidance to Exclude People Without Covid-19 Symptoms, Worrying Experts
snippet: Experts questioned the change, pointing to the importance of finding infections in the brief window just before the onset of symptoms. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: The U.S. first lady, Melania Trump, called Covid-19 an “invisible enemy” and acknowledged the pandemic’s human toll. Kim Jong-un acknowledged ‘shortcomings’ in North Korea’s fight against the virus.

headline: Florida Judge Strikes Down Order Requiring Schools to Physically Reopen Amid Covid-19 Risks
snippet: President Trump cited the approval as welcome news in the fight against the virus. The first confirmed case of reinfection was found in Hong Kong. Here’s the latest.
abstract: Quarantine rules are expanding around the world, but not in America. The virus is circulating in Gaza. Researchers in Hong Kong find that in rare cases, a person can get reinfected.

headline: College Officials Clamp Down on Student Behavior Over Covid-19 Fears
snippet: Shutdowns and warnings follow incidents on college campuses. In his convention speech, Joe Biden outlined a national strategy. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Joe Biden criticized President Trump’s virus response and outlined a strategy to fight the pandemic. Overburdened health care specialists are finding themselves on the front lines as schools reopen.

headline: As U.S. Schools Move to Reopen Despite Covid-19, Teachers Threaten to Strike
snippet: Some teachers’ unions pushed to delay opening schools, and more colleges went online only. Gov. Andrew Cuomo of New York had a few regrets. Here’s the latest.
abstract: Barack Obama and other Democrats denounced President Trump’s handling of the coronavirus crisis. North Korea said that floods, sanctions and the virus had hurt its economy.

headline: U.N.C. at Chapel Hill Shifts to Remote Learning After a Covid-19 Outbreak
snippet: The university at Chapel Hill announced its plans after new cases emerged. The postmaster general agreed to testify before a House panel. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: The virus is roaring again in France. Louis DeJoy, the U.S. postmaster general, agreed to testify before the House Oversight Committee on Aug. 24.

headline: Entertainment Is Power in Push for Racial Justice
snippet: Pro sports are going on strike. Will other industries follow?
abstract: Pro sports are going on strike. Will other industries follow?

headline: Almost 500 Million Children Are Cut Off From School in Pandemic, Report Says
snippet: The Justice Department is considering an investigation of nursing-home outbreaks in four Democratic-led states, including New York.  California makes a deal to more than double testing capacity.
abstract: The Justice Department is considering an investigation of nursing-home outbreaks in four Democratic-led states, including New York. California makes a deal to more than double testing capacity.

headline: The Unique U.S. Failure to Control the Virus
snippet: Slowing the coronavirus has been especially difficult for the United States because of its tradition of prioritizing individualism and missteps by the Trump administration.
abstract: Slowing the coronavirus has been especially difficult for the United States because of its tradition of prioritizing individualism and missteps by the Trump administration.
byline: By David Leonhardt and Lauren Leatherby

headline: U.S. Coronavirus Cases Top 6 Million
snippet: The F.D.A. chief signaled willingness to approve a vaccine before human trials are complete. Global cases passed 25 million. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: The jump in infections comes as the daily rate continues to decline. New Delhi is reopening its subway, even as India sets global records for new cases.

headline: U.S. Authorizes Plasma Treatment for Virus, but the Big Prize for the White House Is a Vaccine
snippet: The agency approved the use of blood plasma from people who have recovered from the virus for the treatment of hospitalized patients. Here’s the latest.
abstract: The fast-tracking could come before Phase 3 trials are complete, raising concerns. Life in China, where the pandemic began, is returning to normal.

headline: At Least 97,000 Children in the U.S. Tested Positive in Last 2 Weeks of July
snippet: The report comes as parents and education leaders grapple with the challenges of resuming schooling. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Trump’s unilateral economic relief actions come under fire. Ohio’s governor urges use of rapid tests, but with caution after his false positive.

headline: Scientists Worry About Political Influence Over Coronavirus Vaccine Project
snippet: Operation Warp Speed, the U.S.’s virus vaccine initiative, has moved along rapidly, but some fear pressure to deliver an October surprise for President Trump.
abstract: Operation Warp Speed has moved along at a rapid clip. But some people involved in the process fear pressure to deliver an October surprise for President Trump.
byline: By Sharon LaFraniere, Katie Thomas, Noah Weiland, Peter Baker and Annie Karni

headline: Birx Warns That U.S. Epidemic Is in a ‘New Phase’
snippet: Dr. Deborah Birx urged Americans in hot spots to consider wearing a mask at home if they live with someone who is especially vulnerable.
abstract: Colleges are preparing to welcome students back to a complicated campus setting. India’s home minister tests positive.

headline: California Moves Toward Easing Coronavirus Restrictions on Business
snippet: Gov. Gavin Newsom’s new rules would allow some counties to reopen many businesses indoors with limits as early as Monday. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Local health departments called on the C.D.C. to change new recommendations that people without symptoms do not need to be tested. Many infected children show no symptoms, a study found.

headline: White House, Under Fire for Discouraging Coronavirus Testing, Says It Will Buy Millions of Test Kits
snippet: The move came after the C.D.C. was criticized for discouraging some testing. President Trump promised a vaccine by the end of the year. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: President Trump promised a vaccine by the end of the year. For hurricane-battered Louisiana and Texas, a confluence of disaster.

headline: Texas Has Too Many Cases to Reopen, Governor Warns
snippet: Emerging clusters at U.S. schools raised concerns about community spread. The number of virus cases worldwide has now passed 20 million. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: Russia approved a vaccine that has yet to complete clinical trials. The White House announced a deal to manufacture 100 million doses of its vaccine candidate. New Zealand returned to a partial lockdown.

headline: Trump’s Order on Coronavirus Relief Alarms Governors as Stimulus Talks Stall
snippet: Democrats were harshly critical of the order, and even Republicans said it could seriously strain their budgets. Catch up on the latest.
abstract: The Trump administration is ordering schools on Native American reservations to reopen. California’s chief health officer has resigned. The pandemic has now sickened more than 20 million people, according to a Times database.

headline: Needed: A Safe Vaccine, Masks and Face Shields
snippet: Readers say we need to make sure any vaccine is safe, and remind us that for now masks and distancing are reliable.
abstract: Readers say we need to make sure any vaccine is safe, and remind us that for now masks and distancing are reliable.
